website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty hiking shoe that successfully combines fashion and functionality.
pros: Quality construction with a feminine touch
Waterproof fabric keeps your feet warm and comfortable
cons: Not as lightweight as some of the other shoes mentioned here

customer_reviews.title: Let's go to Bryce Canyon!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching low and high for a good pair of hiking boots. These boots have great support, both around the ankle and arch, the soles are grippy. I customized the fit by using a lacing "window" and the heel lock method. I plan on using leukotape to prevent blisters or hot spots. These boots support my feet extremely well with plenty of options for adjustments if needed. I have foot issues (multiple surgeries on left foot, arthritis, plantar fasciitis) so finding the right (and left ha-ha) boot is extremely important to me. Very pleased with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Somebodys Mother

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff and don't seem durable
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly disappointed to find that, after less than 3 miles on trails around our house, the first layer of tread was already wearing through. I had to get the wide size, which fit better than regular - but the soles are very stiff and hurt my arches, too. It really is too bad because they are great looking boots! I'm not sure if I got a bum pair or if my feet just didn't like them, but even so, the fact that the inner layer of tread was showing through after such a short amount of time is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Carr kids

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a zookeeper so I'm extremely hard on shoes (mud, daily hosing, on my feet all day, etc...) these have held up really well. I did seal them with waterproof spray, but they have so far held up to daily hosing despite the outside getting completely soaked. They are really comfortable and didn't take too much breaking in. I've only had them for a few months (most shoes give out after 6 for me) but I will update when we get there. There are no signs of the sole coming off or the seams coming apart yet, which is great!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: good arch and normal heel
customer_reviews.text: Once again another pair of "wide" boots that are just wide all over and NOT in the toe box. I need a wide toe box, good arch and normal heel. These lack adequate space in the toes, average to low arch support and plenty of room in the heel, filled up with thick hiking sock, which then squeezes the toe box more. I will say they have kept my feet warm and dry in wet 30 and 40 degree mornings here in the ADK's.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't keep these boots because they were a little too small. I take a 9 1/2 in running shoes and I should have known to go up a 1/2 half to a 10 in these. They are really well-made and look great, I will probably pick them up in the size 10 later on. GET A HALF-SIZE UP!! from your normal size. UPDATE: I did purchase them again in the size 10(B) medium and I highly recommend these hiking boots. They are well-made, look like they will be durable, and they look nice, I got the Gargoyle/Damson color combo. They are relatively light, comfortable and a perfect fit. Again, you should order a 1/2 bigger than your normal size.
customer_reviews.author: Pinhead

customer_reviews.title: Great for Moderate Hikes and lots of Walking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for a summer trip to Iceland and they are just want I needed! I have a pretty narrow foot and it was hard finding hiking boots that I didn't slide around in. Laced well - these did the trick. I didn't really break them in all that much before our trip - but didn't have issues with blisters or pain. They are pretty light weight and really supported my ankles well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feel good / Look good on the trail!
customer_reviews.text: OH my GOODNESS! These shoes are SO comfortable and SO WARM! I was camping and hiking in Big Bend NP and my feet felt GREAT! So comfy, I was even able to sleep in them on the night when the temperature fell to 23 degrees. The rest of me was super cold, but my feet were not! Woah!
customer_reviews.author: Nicci H.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable boots, great support!
customer_reviews.text: I put these on right away & wore them the rest of the day, great fit! I have a wide foot & have a heck of a time finding shoes to fit. Boots of any kind are usually a nightmare. I love these, I wear a 9.5 wide, that is what I ordered & they fit perfectly! Very very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: They were just a bit stiff when I first wore them but they are very comfortable. No rubs or sore spots. I have bad feet and I can walk through tough wet terrain easily with these and they provide great support. I even wore them when we baled hay this summer for the toughness and stability they provide. They look almost like new after a lot of abuse and wet, muddy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: horsin aroundgal

customer_reviews.title: I personally would go up a 1/2 size.
customer_reviews.text: I returned these over a week ago on the same day I received them, and still awaiting my refund. And, where it says: "Contact Owner", an "Error" message appears. They were a little snug in the 8.5. I researched these boots, size measurements, etc. Maybe it was just these boots, but something was pushing inward against the outer right side of boot, and they felt a little heavy and uncomfortable. Didn't have a chance to hike, so they are probably solid. But I prefer a comfy sole, which these felt hard.
customer_reviews.author: melodymaker61

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These boots have just survived a trip to three very wet, muddy, countries for the last month, with no breaking in period needed. Kept my feet dry and warm through many a puddle and stream. Very comfortable right from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: snowshoes

customer_reviews.title: Narrow foot perfection
customer_reviews.text: No more double inserts to make my boots fit. With Bates, Asolo, and Keen I have to use double inserts because most hiking or work boots seem to be made for people with wider feet. Mine are somewhat narrow, especially in the heel. These fit perfect. Wish I would've tried them years ago. Wore them all day at work and never got off my feet. Super comfortable. Will be getting Vasque from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Cann

customer_reviews.title: One good boot, one bad boot.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots last fall for the summer of 2017 hiking. I wore them around my house the first day I got them. I just started wearing them this week to get them broken in for the summer. The left boot feels great, the right boot has a weird pressurer point on the inside bottom of the heel area. I am so dissappointed, I spent alot of money on these and don't think I will be able to hike in them. I am past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Lea McDill

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff and hurt while hiking Mt Kilimanjaro
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to hike Mt Kilimanjaro, and was disappointed because my feet ached for most of the 6 day-hike. Just two hours into hiking, and the soles of my feet were very painful. Granted, I did not sufficiently break in the boots, but I have never had this problem with other boots I've owned. I was very disappointed because the reviews praised this model, and they are also very beautiful. If you buy them, beware that you'll need to break them in A LOT before they feel comfortable to wear. I ended up using a combination of insoles to lessen the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy trails, happy feet
customer_reviews.text: Happy feet from the minute I put them on. I need good hiking boots for my daily job. These exceeded my expectations. Update: They are light, supportive and comfortable. I am on my second pair. However, I noticed over time one of the boots pinched my toes a bit (my larger foot). I do wear them for 8 hours a day and I have kinda square feet anyway-- I call them "my Fred's" in honor of Fred Flindstone:-/ so I ordered the wide this time and they are truly perfect! The boots hold up. I give them an enthusiastic thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amount of pizazz!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these shoes a few times so far for hiking and outdoor activities. They are super comfortable and lightweight for this type of boot. I find myself tripping over my feet from the heigh and weight of these but that's just from my inexperience with hiking shoes or boots. I highly recommend these! I bought them in the wide size because they were cheaper and they might be a tad big but it's worth it to save the additional money. Please buy!! Also they are soooo cute and a great neutral color with just a slight bit of pizazz.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Super waterproof, excellent investment
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how much I love these boots. I have tested them out in fresh snow (up to 5-foot drifts), melting snow/slush, puddles, and super muddy terrain so far, and my feet have stayed dry all the time. I get good traction while walking, and they support my feet and ankles. I ordered half a size up (no wide in my size) so I could wear thicker socks and I am glad I did. I tested them with thinner socks too, and still a nice fit (tighter laces). Best shoe investment I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette

customer_reviews.title: They feet hurt so bad when hiking
customer_reviews.text: They feet hurt so bad when hiking. Something about the design inside that squezes my feet at the metatarsal bones. Hot spots under the feet as well. My feet ached and died in these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than. Expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with these boots. Very comfortable and excellent support. I hadn’t hiked in a long time and needed support for my ankles and these boots were perfect. I have worn them for an entire day and my feet were comfortable and warm on a cold day! Love these boots!!
customer_reviews.author: Doria Foote

customer_reviews.title: Not a true wide shoe
customer_reviews.text: If you need a wide hiking boot pass this on by. I wear a 9 wide and while the length felt right the width was too narrow. I have a pair of Keen's n a 9 regular and they are wider then these. I'll be sending these back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far I love them. I can wear them all day pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I love them. I can wear them all day pretty comfortably. The only problem is sometimes the laces come off the top eyelets and I have to retie the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Toe box is very sturdy & therefore protective. I haven’t taken them out on the trail yet - that happens in a few days. Meanwhile, they have logged some urban hiking miles & are super comfy. I’m gravitating to them over my running shoes, for warmth & comfort in the cool San Francisco air.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from the first step
customer_reviews.text: I love the boots so far. I am planning a hiking vacation next month and bought them in time to get used to them/break them in. The boots were comfortable from the first step and are high enough that they provide good ankle support. I have a narrow foot and bought these boots because they were reported to run narrow and they fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: dvmin

customer_reviews.title: "Wide" but still too narrow in the toe
customer_reviews.text: In so many ways this is a great boot and I really wanted to like it. However, even though it was comfortable through the middle part of my foot, it was tight in the toes. Not uncomfortably so when I first put them on, but when I thought about how my toes would feel after a day's hiking I knew it wouldn't be good. Sadly I had to send them back. The Amazon return process worked smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Former Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Just right.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots after the soles fell off my old ones. Really! Who knew that after nearly 20 years these things will actually get rotten...? After reading the other reviews I decided to get a half-size larger than my usual; that was the right choice for me. First time out, no break-in period, these boots felt great. I wore medium-weight socks, had room in the toe box but everything was comfortably snug and provided great ankle support. I am not a strenuous hiker but do like to go onto forest trails occasionally; these boots are just right.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Heath

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots for Long Hikes and Adventures!
customer_reviews.text: These boots always take a little time to adjust to my feet. Even so, they always feel great right away and as they are broken in, even better. They are a little bit higher around the ankle than my last pair without being as high as a backpacking boot might be and this is great for support. These are SUPER waterproof! Great buy and fit to size. If you are between two sizes, 8.5 or 9, buy the 9 if your feet are a little wider but not too wide, and 8.5 if you have slightly more narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: This shoe gave me several large blisters. Even though I purchased a wider shoe option, my feet felt very constricted in the toe box. I wish i can return them.
customer_reviews.author: Isa

customer_reviews.title: They were very comfortable from day 1
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for a trip to Yosemite. Did not have time to wear them before the trip. They were very comfortable from day 1. We spent four days at Yosemite in pouring rain hiking and walking. Many of the paved paths were small rivers and my feet never got wet. There were some slippery spots with moss and snow but I never slipped. The boots never felt heavy even after wearing them for 12+ hours a day. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Pennydoodle

customer_reviews.title: new style, not the same boot
customer_reviews.text: I have had at least 4 pair of "this" boot--the previous style, and have been able to wear them right out of the box, including Rim to Rim of the Grand Canyon and a 2week trip in Bhutan. This new style is slimmer (although I ordered a Wide as I have previously had) and the toe box is smaller than they state in the description. Also, the boot is a little higher on the ankle and the tongue smaller, barely closing when tied. Now after several years, I have to find the perfect boot!
customer_reviews.author: hw-Phoenix, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Love the way this boot looks
customer_reviews.text: Love the way this boot looks! Seems solidly built but lacking the arch support that I wanted. I have high arches and without the support my feet will fatigue sooner. So sad, because I love everything else about this boot.
customer_reviews.author: John Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great for walking working in yard or going to store. Very comfortable and supportive. Tennis shoes make my feet break out so I tried these and my feet do not sweat or ever hurt. Glad I got them!!
customer_reviews.author: christine sexton

customer_reviews.title: Stiff boot
customer_reviews.text: Boot was so stiff it hurt the top of my foot to walk. It seems like it would help if the tongue had more padding. Not the boot for me.
customer_reviews.author: CLS

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots! Hike in any and all weather
customer_reviews.text: Have been hiking in these boots for a year and a half in all sorts of weather. These are probably my 4th or 5th pair of Vasque hiking boots so I always know that they'll be comfortable when I order a new pair. These are probably my favorite pair yet! Love these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Too big and heavy for me
customer_reviews.text: In most of the reviews for these shoes, it is recommended to get a 1/2 size larger than your normal size because they run small. I disagree. I took that advice and the half size larger were way too big for me. I would suggest sticking to your normal shoe size. Overall, I thought they were too big and heavy even if I had gotten my normal shoe size. I ended up going with another hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Run Small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in size 11...way too small. I normally wear a 10 or 11 and these were more like a very small 10. Unfortunately, they don't come in a bigger size, so they were returned.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy hiking boot with zero break-in issues!
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots! Size up at least a half to one full size up to allow for heavier socks and feet swelling during exercise, plus a roomier toe-box for downhill hikes. These shoes feel very sturdy and go over the ankle for good stability. I wore these straight out of the box for a week-long hiking trip and had no issues with break-in.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Slothower

customer_reviews.title: Ain't no Mountain high enough
customer_reviews.text: I needed a decent pair of hiking boots living in the Pacific NW and these are now my favorite pair of shoes. I feel like I can do anything when I'm wearing my Talus Treks. I think they will last for many years to come and when I replace them I know where to go.
customer_reviews.author: Annie M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are glorious! Unfortunately I ended up returning these (long story short, not enough space in carry on & can't fully justify the purchase), but when I find a good enough reason to buy (and keep!) hiking boots these will be the ones! Nice shoelaces, excellent craftsmanship, and fit perfectly! A lot of hiking boots need 1/2-1 size larger, but I ordered these in my usual size 9 and they fit like a dream. I agree with the other reviewers, these are perfect for regular to narrow feet. I hated to have to send these back, but it helps to know these will be my go-to boots in the future. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: 000 foot elevation gain trek and they felt great! NOTE
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid hiker with a narrow foot, and this is the first pair of hiking boots that have worked for me. I broke them in a little, then took them on a 10 mile 2,000 foot elevation gain trek and they felt great! NOTE: to fit my narrow feet I put in a pair of blue Superfeet, then they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Row10

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this is a real Vasque Shoe. It is extremely uncomfortable even after I put insoles in the shoe. I have tried on Vasque Boots before in shoe stores and they felt much better. This one seems to be a cheap imitation. Don't waste your money on this boot. Seems very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 9,5, which is my normal size in walking shoes and boots. Sometimes I even need a 10. Unfortunatey size was too big. The boots have a very good quality with real leather. You can smell it. The design and color are also very nice. I had to return it because of the size.
customer_reviews.author: Purewater

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I just got theses boots on Saturday, tried them out the same day. I ended up getting a half size bigger in wide. glad I did they fit perfect. I also got the Gargoyle/Damson I love the color. It did not take long to break them in. super comfortable. I have always been a fan of vasque.
customer_reviews.author: Shemm

customer_reviews.title: ... and got these in 11 also and they feel great. I broke them in on a 6 mile ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a woman's 11 in my regular shoes and got these in 11 also and they feel great. I broke them in on a 6 mile muddy trail and they worked great! I live in the south and they did not make me overheat but I don't know how they would do in the cold. I love the style and they seems very well built and look super cute!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Cute and not too thick in the sole.
customer_reviews.text: I've been hunting for a comfortable boot that wasn't TOO thick on the bottom, and this fits the bill! It's very comfortable and provides enough support so my ankle doesn't flop. They're supposed to be waterproof but I haven't tested them yet in the Portland rain, here's hoping though!
customer_reviews.author: theredheadsaid

customer_reviews.title: All day comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife and followed a recommendation of going slightly larger than she wears and they fit her great. She loves them and likes the color. She needed them for a motorcycle training course, and also wanted boots for hiking. Double duty with one purchase. Wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Stidham

customer_reviews.title: My hiking shoe experience
customer_reviews.text: Although the shoe is not as light in weight as I thought, I appreciate that my foot is very protected. I have not worn them in hard terrain,so I can't give an opinion yet.I am definitely glad I chose a wide shoe so I can feel comfortable with thick socks on.The shoe is a keeper for me and looks super on my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Grippy soles and great anke support!
customer_reviews.text: Once broken in, they're comfy and lightweight, and track well on rocky terrain. Great ankle support. Average width along foot bridge. Roomy toe box and proper arch support for me (average need). Bought a full size up from normal shoe size and I will need thicker socks for everything to fit 100%, but going up only a half size may not have been enough room.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for the new hiker...
customer_reviews.text: New hiker. Wanted a decent boot without dropping bank on a pair. Great ankle support and grip. These are great boots for the price. I was looking for my first boot to go on 5-10mi hikes on well-maintained trails and these boots fit the bill- no real break-in period, although the I did get blisters on my heels (this is only when the incline is steep and I realize my foot shifts in the boot going uphill). I am usually a size 8, sometimes a 7.5, but I took an 8 in these and they are perfect with my thick hiking socks. Very happy, would recommend to anyone looking for a starter boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Narducci

customer_reviews.title: Favorite hiking boots.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of vasque boots. They are the best. I think they run small. My normal size is 10, but order 11 for vasque boots.
customer_reviews.author: Online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for high instep
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a wide foot with a high instep (when ordering wide). Not my Summer hiker! They are water resistant so I find them most practical from Fall to Spring. I wear size 7 medium in tennis shoes. Size 8 wide fit me well with a mid weight to heavy sock in this hiker. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: TMur

customer_reviews.title: Not a comfortable boot.
customer_reviews.text: They felt uncomfortable for the short duration I had them on. That was the main reason for sending them back. Something just didn't feel right.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy A. Gourlay

customer_reviews.title: Love the stiffer sole because going over rocks is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish the size I needed came in a Wide to accommodate an injury on one foot, but unfortunately not. Love the stiffer sole because going over rocks is a breeze and feels very stable. The boot is actually more true to size and can fit a heavy sock without going up a size; has lots of toe room. Longer laces would be good, but otherwise lightweight, waterproof, and cute!
customer_reviews.author: Dorie Moore

customer_reviews.title: I have been freezing my toes off in this snow and desperately needed a better boot. My husband has a pair of this ...
customer_reviews.text: Loooove them. I have been freezing my toes off in this snow and desperately needed a better boot. My husband has a pair of this brand that he loves so I decided to try it. I use them everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: luz sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife who had hiking shoes but not boots and needed additional ankle support. She loves them! Took them on our trip to Mammoth and they did great in loose gravel, snow, and mud.
customer_reviews.author: Doonie Carlos

customer_reviews.title: FIRM COMFORTABLE SUPPORT- great styling
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Vasques years ago and I outgrew them. They were not worn out, but I remember they were a bit heavy. The new pair is so comfortable I often wear them after my morning hike most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: G-A

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The shoelaces wouldn’t stay put when tying. Had to hold them in the hooks. The boot was too narrow
customer_reviews.author: Pj

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are amazing. I have worn them three times now on different terrain including steep rocky stretches and they have been beyond comfortable. I have narrow heels and this is my fourth pair of boots in three years and finally I have a pair that does not give me blisters on my heels and is also sturdy with great traction. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: These solved all of my foot problems. I'm glad I didnt buy the ones I tried on at the store. They would have been too hot. These are easy to get on and stabilize my foot well. They are sized exactly right. I took all of my other hiking boots to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Lolita Wike

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Relatively light weight, important for those trekking. I’d buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Juliane Araujo Nunes

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These Boots run extremely small I'm a size 8 I had to buy a size 9
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight over the top of my foot
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking hiking boot, I wish it had fit correctly. I have a high instep and a slightly wide foot, so I purchased an 8 wide. The width and length were fine but it was too tight over the top of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First hiking boots and I love them. Didn't have to break them in
customer_reviews.text: First hiking boots and I love them. Didn't have to break them in. They were very comfy and love the extra support just above the ankle. First took them on a 6 mile hike and no blisters or discomfort feet instead happy feet.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot - very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I tried on several hiking shoes at stores around town, then came home and bought the Vasque on Amazon and saved quite a bit of money. The fit is great and overall, it's a really good hiking boot. I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item - to small and very hard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and great for day hikes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for light day hikes on trails. Very comfortable right out of the box. Enough support that if I needed to carry a light pack it would be Ok. Good looking boot.
customer_reviews.author: idateacher2Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Best, longest lasting, most comfortable boots ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these boots. Vasque hiking boots are the only brand I buy bc they are just a great boot. The first pair I bought literally lasted 20 years. And I wore them all the time. I got this pair for work bc I was just in a car wreck and the doctors told me I need a better shoe than I am currently wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Renee'

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe. I have purchased this brand before
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe. I have purchased this brand before. I would have given it five stars except that a little bit of extra toe area would be better. I do happen to have a hard-to-fit foot, though, with a narrow heel, so for me the review should probably be a 41/2 star.. It is still the best fit I have found in an athletic shoe aside from custom-made shoes.
customer_reviews.author: P. West

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hiking boot- climbed Kumano Kudo with no issues - highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stability and adaptable with orthotics
customer_reviews.text: Love the support. My custom orthotic fits perfectly. I feel stable on this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: I love Vasque hiking boots and these are no exception
customer_reviews.text: I love Vasque hiking boots and these are no exception. I use them to work in the garden. They are a medium duty hiking boot and are good for day hikes and short backpack trips. I would not use them on a multi week trip though, for that I use the Vasque St. Elias boot.
customer_reviews.author: Audra L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing another pair of Vasque boots that were comfortable and held up great and so far I am not disappointed. I was a little concerned about the neon green, but I went with it because I didn't want to pay $20 extra for the other color and it's not as obnoxious as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy in So Cal

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, sturdy, excellent fit. I did not order a half size up...I ordered my regular size ....plenty of room for heavy socks. Am very happy with these and would order again. Great support for my entire foot and ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo happy I decided to go with the Vasque! Was seriously considering to but Keens because I have many other pairs ans love them, but my first pair of hiking boots were Vasque and they lasted me 20 years and are still in good shape, it was just time for an upgrade
customer_reviews.author: Wildflower

customer_reviews.title: Too wide.
customer_reviews.text: I had owned a pair of Vasque boots years ago and really liked them. I returned the boots because I believed that they were narrower than some of the boots that are marked and Medium. They are well made and I wish they fit me. I am hoping to find another pair that is Narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to reputation!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, great ankle support, light-weight. Quickly becoming my new favorite shoe since l walk a lot
customer_reviews.author: kis2189

customer_reviews.title: Love Vasque.
customer_reviews.text: Last Vasque boots I bought lasted nearly 30 years. I expect these will be the last ones I ever have to buy...Love Vasque...love these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase! These boots are perfect for hiking in snow, rain, and colder weather. I’ve hiked more then 6miles straight in them, without any irritation. Very comfortable with a flexible sole and sturdy ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these hiking boots! Already tackled multiple national and state parks and still feel so comfortable. The color is perfect because even when they get muddy, they still look good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality and price
customer_reviews.text: made well, fit well and priced right. does the job.
customer_reviews.author: vlchek

customer_reviews.title: Wide?
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to tell that they're "wide." They'll get the job done, but they're not as comfortable as I'd hoped. Hopefully they'll break in well.
customer_reviews.author: betty7

customer_reviews.title: I liked these but they aren't made for high arches
customer_reviews.text: I liked these but they aren't made for high arches. I felt my foot going numb after wearing them in the house for 10 minutes. They went back. Too bad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They were great looking, my problem was they were to narrow ...
customer_reviews.text: They were great looking, my problem was they were to narrow on my feet, I should have gotten the wide ones.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: comfortable from first hike
customer_reviews.text: Did not need breaking in...comfortable from first hike. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sckaren

customer_reviews.title: Good for Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves em. She's 8.5 wider than normal feet. She says these are the most comfortable boots she's ever worn. She loves the style as well.
customer_reviews.author: UrKungFuNoGood

customer_reviews.title: Go a full size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Bought half size larger in case feet swell up during long hikes and when I received them, it was a little snug. Not tight but not much wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: weekend cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Hiked Colorado and never had any soreness from the first day I wore them. Perfect for people if you turn your ankles often while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: pinkladyturtle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and comfortable. Required no breaking in. Excellent going through red rock sand, over boulders, up and down rocky trails.
customer_reviews.author: BJD

customer_reviews.title: I have tried other boots and haven’t been satisfied..
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other boots and haven’t been satisfied... these boots fit well. Give great support... and wear well
customer_reviews.author: Della  Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift. She loves them and uses them often.
customer_reviews.author: reagangirl

customer_reviews.title: Lots of ankle stability and good support for uneven trails
customer_reviews.text: Warm, dry feet. Lots of ankle stability and good support for uneven trails. No break in period needed. I ordered a half size larger to accommodate thicker socks. Good boot!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M Braddock

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t hiked in them yet but they seemed comfortable when I tried them on.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Nice hikers
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a while for women’s hikers in a wide width. I’ve had foot surgery and need a wide toe box and these are almost as comfortable as my new balance running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: cathryn joiner

customer_reviews.title: I put them on and they felt perfect. I wore them at work the first day ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a wide shoe and bought 1/2 size larger to accommodate socks. I put them on and they felt perfect. I wore them at work the first day and they did not feel like a pair of new shoes. I had never heard of this brand before but I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: David Cordero

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hiking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Loved these shoes. Fit was comfortable. I wore them in the rain a couple times and even stepped in a mud puddle and my socks didn't get wet. Highly recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: AllyBe

customer_reviews.title: Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these very light and snazzy looking hikers! They were just what I needed to give me some ankle support, and more confidence negotiating the rough terrain on my propert.
customer_reviews.author: K von Eerie

customer_reviews.title: It's s very comfortable shoe with lots of ankle and arch support
customer_reviews.text: It's s very comfortable shoe with lots of ankle and arch support. I ordered 1/2 size bigger and the length was great. The show is just a little narrow for me.
customer_reviews.author: Donna T.

customer_reviews.title: These are great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great hiking shoes. This is the 3rd pair of Vasque hiking shoes I've bought. They always live up to my expectations - comfortable right out of the box and I need the waterproof feature.
customer_reviews.author: B H Holm

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! Light, comfortable, and waterproof on my hiking trip. No break in needed.
customer_reviews.author: melissa Bohmer

customer_reviews.title: and fairly comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The tongue sits crooked and is too thick. Over time, they have really started hurting the tops of my feet. By the end of the day, it feels like they cut off the circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot; needs to be wide as stated
customer_reviews.text: Order wide size; was not wide enough. Returned. Nice boot; needs to be wide as stated.
customer_reviews.author: D. Salvaryn

product_meta.title: Vasque Women's Talus Trek UltraDry Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: At Vasque, they are committed to making functional, innovative and aesthetic footwear that performs to the highest standards. Their ultimate goal is to make shoes that inspire you to get outdoors and embark on an adventure. Incorporating and developing new and innovative technologies into their boots is what keeps Vasque at the top of their game.
feature_bullets: Mid-cut hiker featuring thick waterproof nubuck leather with ghillie lacing and breathable mesh underlays
